summary: This bill, H.R. 988, proposes amendments to title 36 of the United States Code concerning the National Woman's Relief Corps. It aims to move the organization's place of incorporation and domicile from the District of Columbia to Illinois. Additionally, the bill seeks to relocate the Corps' principal office to Murphysboro, Illinois, and designates the Secretary of State of Illinois for service of process, replacing the previous designation in the District of Columbia. Several changes based on this goal are present in the bill's text.
